title: Building Team Identity
content: Team identity creates commitment beyond individual interest. Shared history, rituals, language, and success build identity. Strong identity supports effort during difficulty and accountability to peers. But identity must include outsiders enough to enable cross-team coordination.

mcq.question: Your team has developed strong internal bonds but resists working with other teams. What's the concern?

options.A: No concernâ€”strong teams should protect their culture
options.B: Excessive identity can create silos that harm organizational effectiveness
options.C: Other teams should adapt to yours

mcq.explanation: Team identity is valuable but can become tribal. When 'us vs. them' extends to other internal teams, coordination suffers. Healthy identity includes connection to broader organizational purpose.

openQuestions: What creates team identity in your group?
How do you maintain team identity while staying connected to the broader organization?
